summary: The Quantum National Security Coordination and Competition Act of 2025 mandates the Secretary of Defense to establish or designate an office within the Department of Defense to lead all quantum technology efforts. This office will focus on research, development, application, and policy related to quantum technology, including quantum sensing, computing, and communications. The bill also requires coordination with other federal agencies, the establishment of a Quantum Coordination Office for National Security, and the submission of triennial reports to Congress on U.S. quantum capabilities compared to those of competing nations, especially China, Russia, and Iran. The initial report must include a detailed assessment of quantum communications technology.
